Description: Pain or discomfort in the head or scalp, often caused by stress, tension, or illness.
A temporary increase in body temperature, often due to infection or inflammation.
Generalized muscle or joint pain throughout the body, typically associated with flu or fatigue.
A sudden, forceful expulsion of air through the nose and mouth, commonly due to allergies or a cold.
Irritation or discomfort in the eyes often caused by allergies, dryness, or infection.
A burning sensation in the chest caused by acid reflux or indigestion.
A reflex action to clear your airways of mucus or irritants, commonly due to cold or flu.
Frequent, loose, or watery bowel movements often caused by infection or food intolerance.
Soreness or discomfort in the throat, usually caused by infections, allergies, or dryness.
Difficulty or infrequent bowel movements, typically due to poor diet, dehydration, or medication.
Breaks or tears in the skin usually caused by injury, requiring cleaning and protection.
